Sound Issues Plagued Lady Gaga's Grammy Performance, Too 
Praying for the sound guys at this point üòê. Most Popular By Lori Keong and Maggie Maloney Feb 12, 2017 After a Super Bowl Halftime show that was *sheer* perfection , we were beyond excited to see what was in store for Lady Gaga's Grammy performance . Before the Grammys, it was revealed that Gaga would be performing with Metallica, who previously said they had "something very unique and special planned." What resulted was a head-banger that made for one seriously fierce Lady Gaga performance, as she sported a Metallica tank and snarled into the microphone like a natural metal-head. But the same frustrations Adele experienced with sound issues earlier (and last year, too) were a consistent theme in this performance, since members of Metallica's microphones didn't even seem to be on at the beginning of the performance. Gaga shook off the sound issues like a pro, though, and ended the performance crowd-surfing and twirling on them haters, which may be the only appropriate way to end a somewhat awkward performance with dignity.
